header.matter: MURDER AND ATTEMPTED MURDER OF IFP MEMBERS

testimony: Thank you everybody.  We will now be commencing with the application of Mr Zakhele Amos Zulu.  I have introduced the panel already.  I would request the legal representatives please to place themselves on record.
Mr Chairman, I confirm that I appear on behalf of the applicant in these proceedings.  My surname is Maharaj and the initial is K.
I am Ms Thabela Thabete, the Evidence Leader.  Thank you Mr Chair.

Thank you.  I just again inform the people in the audience that the proceedings are simultaneously translated and in order to get the translation, you have to be in possession of one of these devices.
	English is on channel 2, Zulu is on channel 3.  These devices are available from the Sound Technician in the front here.  Mr Maharaj?
Thank you Mr Chairman, may I proceed.
Thank you Mr Chairman.  Mr Chairman, might I have leave to lead the applicant on certain issues of common cause?
Yes.  If Ms Thabete gets a problem with it, she can object at any time, but I think from the reading of the papers, there seems to be quite a lot that is common cause.

Thank you.  Mr Zulu, it is common cause that you were convicted of the murder of four people in the Durban Supreme Court on the 5th of May 1994, and the names of these people that you have murdered, appear from ...
From pages 23 and 24 of the papers?

Is that correct, you were convicted of the murder of Shlale Shlomile, Alfius Mbaso, Babulo Joseph Mthetwa, Sitize Dadada Ndamande and Johannes Hlatswayo and also of the attempted murder of Mpikiseni Njoyisa?  Is that correct?
Mr Zulu, is it not also correct that you were sentenced in respect of all these offences to serve a term of imprisonment of 12 years?
During or about July 1992, can you please tell the Committee where were you residing?
I was residing in Ndwedwe, Madada.
Can you please specify in which area of Ndwedwe or Madada were you residing?
I resided in Madada, the area that was Inkatha area.
Was there any specific name that was ascribed to this Inkatha area that you resided in?
How long is it that you resided in this area for?
During your lifetime, did you belong to any particular political party?
Were you a member of Inkatha or just a supporter?
I was the Youth Organiser of Inkatha.
For the record, can you tell the Committee whether your parents were members or supporters of the Inkatha party?
They were Inkatha followers, my parents that is.
Did a set of events or circumstances lead you to leave the area that you were residing in and move to some other area?
We were attacked by people of Ngonweni.
Sorry, what was that area?  Can you just say the people of which area?
We were attacked by people of Ngonweni, ANC people.
You say you were attacked, how is it that these attacks came about?
They attacked the IFP base and they killed people, the IFP area that is.
When would you say this had happened?
If my memory serves me right, I think it was in the middle of 1992.
How long before the incident for which you were convicted?
Can you remember how long this attack on you or your area, that forced you to move, how long was that attack before the attack that you are here applying for amnesty for?
If I am not mistaken, I think that took place around August, July.
And as a result of these attacks you say you moved away to another area?

Let's get to the events which led up to the murders of these people, or the killing of these people on the 2nd of February 1993.
	I would like you to tell the Committee how is it that it came, or who is it that decided that these people that belonged, or that these people should be killed.

Since the end of 1992, we were abiding in these areas peacefully, not resenting each other.
	They arrived in 1992 and they attacked the IFP area and killed IFP members.  Soon after that, since we felt this is, the violence was so rife, and we decided we should run away and go and reside in a different area, Ndelani, the area.
	We got there and stayed there a while.  The following year, just before February, before we attacked Mr Buxusa arrived and he is the one who told us that we should go and attack the Ngonweni area and also said, he also told us that we would find those people in a certain place.  We got to that area or to that place at about three o'clock, and we found them indeed gathered there because Mr Buxusa had already told us that they will meet at that particular place for a certain meeting and they were planning a plot against us, discussing a plot against us.
	We got there even before they could get to us, and attacked them right away.
Before you go on, who is Mr Buxusa?
Mr Buxusa was the Head or the leader of the IFP in our area.
Is Buxusa his surname or his first name?
Mr Mbonambi, Mbonambi is the surname, Buxusa is the name.
Do you know what position if any, Mr Buxusa occupied or enjoyed in the IFP?
All I knew about Buxusa was that he is the leader of the IFP in the area, which we resided in.
These acts that you committed on the 2nd of February, were these acts committed as a result of any specific directions from Mr Buxusa Mbonambi?
Tell the Committee in further detail please, what happened when you arrived at this house.
Just before he goes to that, maybe he could just elaborate on what his instructions were before he got there.

Mr Zulu, please tell the Committee what were your instructions from Mr Buxusa Mbonambi if any about you having to go to the area where the ANC, which was occupied by the ANC, what were your instructions?

Mr Buxusa furnished us with instructions that the ANC people at Ngonweni had already killed from our side.  In that way, he went on to say to us that these people should be attacked at a certain place and that is where we will find them, gathering there and we should eliminate them, kill them.
What place was that?  You said a certain place, which is this certain place?
That is the ANC area that we went to attack those people from.
Yes, Ngonweni, the name of the place.
So he didn't specify a particular "moozie" or kraal or house or ...?
He did make mention of the fact that we would get to a certain house and it will be Mthetwa's house, where we will find them.
Did you know which house that was?
The way he gave us the direction and the description of the house, we knew.
Who was in control of your group?
You mean in control, the leader of the Unit, of the group?
Of the group of people that went on this mission?
Do you know who the other three were?
The first one was Linda Luthuli, the second one Zita Zulu, the third one was Ndumiso Sangweni.
Thank you Mr Zulu.  Tell the Committee please what happened when you got to this group of people?
Please repeat your question Mr Maharaj.
What happened when you got to this group of people?
When you got to Mthetwa's house, what happened?
We got there and we stabbed them, and they died.
What were you personally armed with?
I had a knife and a firearm.
Did you use it at all?
I did not use the firearm, I only used my knife.
And can you tell the Committee how were the other persons armed?
Yes, I can tell the Committee.  Zita Zulu had in his possession a butcher's knife and a knife, plus a firearm.  Ndumiso Sangweni had a spear this long, and a firearm.
Slow down a bit, we have to try and write this down and you are going a little bit fast.
You said Sangweni had a spear this long, how long, can you indicate the size of the spear?  He indicates approximately one meter.
He indicates approximately one meter, a stabbing spear.  And Luthuli?
Luthuli had a knife plus a firearm.
Did I hear you correctly that Sangweni also had in addition to that spear, a firearm as well?
When you got to Mthetwa's house, did you identify any specific persons that you wanted to attack?
Yes, we identified those people we were in search of.
And who were these people that you wanted to attack?
Do you mean I should furnish you with their names?
Let me rather rephrase that, how is it that you identified these people as being persons that you wanted to attack?
We knew because the place was demarcated into two sections.  You will find one area or section belonging to the IFP and the other one from the road, be ANC.
You must go a little slower because everybody has to write down notes.  You said that the two areas were demarcated by a road?

And the two different areas that were demarcated by the road, the one area was occupied by members that belonged to the IFP party and the other section was occupied by members that belonged to the ANC party?
Mr Zulu, I would like you to tell the Committee how is it that you identified the persons whom you attacked.  By what means did you identify the persons that you attacked?

According to my knowledge, we knew perfectly well that as that was the ANC and the IFP area, we would leave our base and go and attack the ANC area.  It did not matter as to who would be IFP or ANC, as long as we find you in the ANC area, we will be attacking.
Sorry, in other words, there were no specific persons you were going to attack, but you were going to attack people who were staying in the ANC stronghold?
As I have already explained before, we were already told by Mr Buxusa that we should go to that place and that particular house, that is where we would find these people we were looking for.
But did you have the specific people you were supposed to attack, either by description or by names?
Some of them formed part of the group that attacked us.

You haven't really answered the question.  You see I am hearing you say two different things at the same time, and that is what we are trying to clear up.
	On the one hand you are saying you went to an area, it was demarcated by a road that on one side of the road, was ANC and on the other side of the road, was IFP.
	You would have attacked anybody you found there, regardless of who they were, as long as they were in the ANC area.  Then you add, well it had to be at Mthetwa's house, okay but the way it was put was, it doesn't matter who was there, if they were at that place, you were going to attack them.  That is the one thing that you are saying.
	On the other hand, you are also saying that you went to Mthetwa's house because you knew that the people who had been attacking you, would be at Mthetwa's house.  Can you explain this for us?
The people we were looking for, that we wanted to attack, we have been given information by Mr Buxusa as to where we would locate them.  We went there truly and found them and killed them.

Yes, the question really is this, did Mr Buxusa say to you that you must look for Mr so and so and Mr so and so and Mr so and so or did he just say to you when you get to Mthetwa's place, you will find some people there, I am not sure exactly who they are or what their names are, but whoever is there, you must just kill them?

Mr Buxusa did not give us the names, but he said he had already heard from his reliable sources that they will be gathering there for a meeting on this particular day, so we should go there and that is where we would find them conveniently, and kill them.
And when you attacked these people, you and the other three that were in your company, did you attack these people at random or did you specifically choose a particular victim and attack him?

Mr Zulu, it would appear from the record of the criminal trial against yourself, that neither yourself nor any of your co-perpetrators disguised yourself or made any attempt to conceal your facial features.  Is there any particular reason for that?
Because I wanted the people to see and identify me exactly for who I am, as an IFP, that is why we did not disguise.

At the time that you attacked the deceased and the complainants, the victims, did you or any of your co-perpetrators ever steal any items from the complainants, from the deceased or from any of the victims?
It is also apparent from the record that a certain Mrs Maria Gcabashe was present throughout this attack?
Please repeat what you have just said.
It is apparent from the proceedings in the Supreme Court that a certain Mrs Maria Gcabashe was present throughout this attack that you and your co-perpetrators had done on that day in question?
I don't know the name Maria Gcabashe, it is my first encounter with this name.
During the course of this attack on this people, do you remember seeing a lady out there, who was present and who was witnessing these attacks on the people?
Was any attempt made by yourself or any of your co-perpetrators to kill, maim or injure Maria Gcabashe or the lady that was present on that day in question?
No, we did not attempt that.
Was this attack carried out during the day or at night?
It was during the day, at about three o'clock in the afternoon.
Was there any reason for not attacking the lady or ladies that were present at the time that you committed these attacks?
The reason why we did not attempt to attack the lady, was that she did not form part of the big group that came to attack us in our area, the IFP area that is.
Are you saying then that the other persons that were either killed or assaulted by you and your co-perpetrators, were members of a group, a larger group that attacked people in your area?
About how much prior to this incident in February 1993, did this other attack that you referred to, take place?
Our incident, it was around August 1992 when we were attacked.
As a result of that attack, Mr Zulu, can you tell the Committee whether any members or supporters of the IFP were killed by members of the attacking party?
During the attack, you referred to an attack that took place during or around August 1992, during that attack, were any members of the IFP killed during that attack by the opposing party?
Can you tell the Committee the names of those people that were killed?

The first one was Mr Luthuli, an old man.  The second one was Mr Sithole, he was fairly old as well.
	The third one was Thulani Zulu.
You mentioned Mr Luthuli, was Mr Luthuli related to you in any way?
Mr Luthuli was not related to me.
Was Mr Luthuli related to your co-accused in the criminal proceedings?
You mentioned the third person as being Thulani Zulu, was Thulani Zulu related to you in any way?
Just for completeness sake, Mr Luthuli, what was he to your co-accused?
He was a father to the co-accused.
Of Luthuli or of yourself, or both of you, I don't know?
Mr Zulu, did you identify the party that had actually attacked the IFP and had killed these people?
The first one who was leading them, was Shonisosi.  The second one was Zenzile Shangase.  The others, I don't remember their names, but I know them by sight.

This attack that was mounted upon the deceased and the other complainants in the criminal charge by yourself and your co-perpetrators, I would like you to tell the Committee, was this attack mounted purely as a result of you wanting to get personal vengeance as a result of your relative having been killed, or was it done for any other political reason?
We did not mount this attack as a result that our relatives were killed, but we had to attack them because we would then be free to have our meetings as IFP with no disturbance from the other side.

Let's take the situation a little further, let us assume that a member of the IFP who was residing in your area, the IFP area, had killed your brother, what would have been the proper proceedings, or accepted procedure within your community to have been followed?

Let us assume that a member of your relatives was killed by a member of the IFP, who was residing on your side of the road, what would have been the procedure that would have followed to resolve the matter?
We would have sat down and discussed the matter.

Mr Zulu, at page 39 of the bundle of papers, there is a warning statement that was taken down from you for the purposes of the criminal proceedings.
	In that warning statement you mentioned a person by the name of Mbeki Mkhize.  Can you tell the Committee whether in fact you had furnished the name of that person to the person that had taken down your warning statement?
To tell the honest truth, I don't know this Mbeki Mkhize.  I was in the company of the other three.
The other three that you mentioned to the Committee earlier on?

During the course of the criminal trial, is there any particular reason why you did not tell the Presiding Judge what the reason was for you having been part and parcel of this group that had perpetrated these acts upon the deceased and the complainant?
Won't you please repeat that question.
It is apparent from the criminal record that you never gave the version that you are giving to the Committee today.

The situation that prevailed at the time, was not quite conducive for me to divulge that much information to the Court of law, because I was, I did not plead guilty and I also wanted to shorten the sentence.
	By so doing, I thought that would be effective.

Mr Zulu, the people that were killed and injured, are you satisfied that those were the same people that were part and parcel of a group that had perpetrated an attack upon the IFP camp as it were on a previous occasion?
During the period 1992 - 1993, would you indicate to the Committee, what was the intensity of the violence in the area that you had lived in, in the Ndwedwe, Madada area?

Violence erupted in 1992, until we vacated the area to Lindelani area.  That is where we will mix with the ANC, IFP and ANC.
	We will not live peacefully still in Lindelani, and we were living in a situation that suggested we were fighting, the two groups were fighting each other, the IFP and the ANC.

As a result of the political violence that existed in that area at that particular time, can you indicate to the Committee what was the accepted norm if people had come to your camp and attacked and killed members of the community, or rather members of your political party?
	What was the accepted norm that was used to retaliate against the party that was attacking your party?
With regards to the attackers, it was a usual exercise that we will have to retaliate, since they would have attacked us first.

Thank you Mr Chairman.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR MAHARAJ
Thank you Mr Maharaj.  Ms Thabete, do you have any questions to ask Mr Zulu?
Yes, Mr Chairman, I do, but can I ask for a two minute adjournment.

Yes, we will take a very short adjournment.
COMMITTEE ADJOURNS
Thank you.  Ms Thabete?  I am sorry, if you can just wait for Mr Zulu to get his headphones on.

Mr Chairman, before I proceed, I would like to correct something in the bundle, in the application form in English, the translation.  Page 15, number 10(b).  In Zulu, on the Zulu one it is on page 627, it is from the line in fact we wanted peace in our area, from there onwards it should read we also wanted peace in our organisation, but due to their actions, we could not or we failed to persevere such a situation.
	Due to their actions, we could not or we failed to persevere such a situation, or tolerate.  To tolerate such a situation.  It replaces that whole paragraph, yes because we could also get killed.  We admit to having committed the offences, we ask for forgiveness for the act of killing and injuring ANC people.
	I don't know if you would like the translator to confirm that that is correct from her Zulu version.
Did you hear that Madam Translator?
Yes, I confer, yes, I do confer.
Thank you very much.  Thank you Ms Thabete.
If the Committee members would bear with me.  Mr Zulu, is it correct that you stayed under the then Nkosi Khumalo, at Jojweni area?
I lived in Madada, at Madada (indistinct)
Who was your Nkosi there, your Chief in that area?
Would it be correct to say that the incident occurred at Jojweni under the Nkosi Cele?

In your application, page 16 of the bundle, number 11(a) of your application, you were asked a question who gave you an instruction to commit the offence that you did.  Can you explain why you didn't mention Buxusa Mbonambi?

I am asking you, in your application you were asked a question as to who gave you an order to kill the people you did at Mthetwa's place, and you wrote not applicable.
	What I am asking you is, why didn't you mention Buxusa Mbonambi in your application form?
It is because I was not alone, as I was filling the application form, and I was depending upon the assistance of another person.
What do you mean, do you mean somebody wrote it for you?  Is it not your own words that are written in the application, is that what you are saying?
Those are my words in the application.
So why didn't you mention Buxusa?
I was confused I suppose, it has been long since I have been in prison.
Is it correct that you were actually in your area, you were not a group of four, but you were actually a group of nine, isn't that right?

I am going to ask you now about the incident, when you went to Mthetwa's area, you called aside Musawenkosi, what did you say to him?
	Musawenkosi Cele, yes.
No, I will refute that, I do not have any knowledge of that.
Are you saying you never called him aside, you and your group?
You just came there and you killed all of them?
Yes.  Because we had already been told that that is where we will find them.
In your evidence today you said that you don't know anything about Maria Gcabashe, do you remember?
It is the name and the surname that I don't know, that I heard for the first time here.
Were you in court when you were charged and convicted, were you present in court?
Didn't you hear any mention of Maria Gcabashe who was a witness?
So why are you saying that you never heard of her before?
This Maria Gcabashe we are busy talking about, I know her as a Khumalo, yet married to Mthetwa.  This is why I said I don't know anything about Maria Gcabashe.
Was she referred to as Maria Gcabashe?
Yes, she was referred to as Maria Gcabashe.
Is it not correct that you belonged to a group which called themselves Sinamandla?
No, that is not true, it was one of us whose nickname was Sinamandla.
Is it also not true that in this group or this gang, or are you denying the fact that there was a gang called Sinamandla?
Yes, I am denying that fact.
Whose nickname was Sinamandla?  Which of your group's nickname was Sinamandla?
So you wouldn't know anything about a group that harassed and raped women in your area?
May the speaker repeat her question?

She doesn't have her headphones on, so she can't hear you.  The question was you didn't know about a group of people that harassed and raped women, and harassed the people in the area, called Sinamandla?
No, I have no knowledge to that effect.
Is it not true that you and other people, who - you were a group of people, who went into a church and harassed the reverend, you do not know anything about that?
I don't think it was necessarily in a church, it was at a party where a reverend was holding prayers.
Mr Chairman, my instruction was that it was actually in a church.
No, I don't remember that incident.
Is it also not true that in this area where the deceased were killed, there was no political conflict?
There was political violence at that area.
In your evidence today, in your evidence today, you told us that Linda Luthuli's father was killed and some of your relatives were killed, is that correct?
So, wouldn't you say that you were revenging the death of your relatives and your co-accused's relative?
The fact that our relatives were hurt and were killed, did not matter.  We would have retaliated still even if those people were not related to us.

You see Mr Zulu, I have been instructed by the victims and also our Investigator has investigated, and the finding was that you belonged to a group, a gang that harassed people and raped women in the area and also ...

Just slowly, slowly, put one thing to him at a time please.
	Put one thing to him at a time, so that he can answer one thing at a time.  If you put too many averments to him, then when he answers, we don't know which one he is replying to.
The first thing that has been put to you, it has been put to you that you belonged to a group which harassed people and raped women.
That is not true.  That is a mistake.

Sorry Mr Chairman, can I get guidance here.  I don't know whether I should repeat it one by one, because I actually asked him one by one whether he belonged, and he has denied all of that, so I just wanted to ...
I think he has, that he belonged to a group, he has already said that he hasn't heard of Sinamandla, so I think that is all right, carry on with your questions.
So can I put whatever he has denied, can I put it to him because that is what I want to do now.
Mr Zulu, I was still saying, my instructions and according to our investigation,  you belonged to a gang, Sinamandla which harassed people and women.  You also assaulted a reverend in church.

I think just ask him as you go along, what he says to it each time.  What do you say to that, did you belong to a gang called Sinamandla, you have already denied that.
	It is also put to you that you were part of a group that assaulted a certain reverend?
I have also been instructed Mr Zulu, that actually there was no political conflict in the area, you were just a group of criminals who harassed people, what is your response to that?
I refute all of what you have just said.
It is also my instructions that you targeted innocent people, who were sitting under a tree drinking beer, who had not even attacked you.  What is your response to that?
The people we attacked, formed part of the big group that attacked the IFP people.

Mr Zulu, I am going to call a witness who is going to testify that he was there when your people were attacked, and the people that you attacked, were not part of the people that attacked your relatives.
I am certain about the facts that they were present.  Whether you call him or not, I will still say that in his or her eyes.

Thank you Mr Chairperson, no further questions.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MS THABETE

Thank you.  Mr Maharaj, do you have any re-examination.
NO RE-EXAMINATION BY MR MAHARAJ
Mr Sibanyoni, do you have any questions to ask the witness?
Yes Mr Chairperson.  Mr Zulu, when members of the IFP were attacked, were you present?
When members of the IFP were attacked, were you present?
This took place not too far away from my house, in the neighbourhood, it was in the morning at around six o'clock.  They got there and killed Mr Luthuli and Mr Sithole.
How many were the people who attacked Mr Luthuli and Mr Sithole?
It was a massive group.  I could not count them.
Approximately if you say they were a large group?
I cannot give a rough estimation since it was a large group.
Was it five people, or was it 20 people, was it as many people as are sitting in the auditorium here, was it 1 000 people?  Can't you give some sort of indication?
It my opinion, I would think there were more than 50.  They arrived at about six in the morning.
How did you know that they were ANC members?
How did you know that these people who came to attack, these 50 people, were ANC members?

It is because we saw, we could recognise some of them.  We could tell and establish that these are the people who came to attack and yet at the same time, we knew their names, some of them that is, not all of them.
Are you saying you knew them out of that group of 50 people, that they were people who came to attack?
It was not dark, it was during the day, it was daylight in the morning, so you could tell and recognise the faces.  Some of them, we knew their names, and we knew where they resided as well.
Let's move to the day when you people went to attack at Mthetwa's house.  How many people were there?
I don't remember as to how many there were.
I don't think they were above 25, or more than 25.
What exactly were they doing when you arrived?
Were they sitting down outside the house, under a tree?
Yes, they were outside under a tree, sitting there.

Mr Maharaj asked you a question, which to my mind, you didn't answer.  He said how did you recognise them or identify them as the people who came to attack at your area when you arrived there at Mthetwa's house.
Mr Buxusa had already told us that we would find them at Mthetwa's house, that is where they would have gathered.

I am now at the stage where you arrived at Mthetwa's house, how did you know that these are the people who had attacked you previously or they were different people?  By what marks did you identify them?
Some of them had been present when we had been attacked.
Were all the deceased people present at the previous attack?
Yes, they were present, and even those who were injured, were present when we were attacked.
You said you didn't disguise yourself during this attack, because you wanted the people to know that it was the IFP which attacked, did I understand your correctly?
Yes, that is exactly what I said.
Did you have any other indications, like arm bands or anything to identify yourselves as Inkatha members?
I was wearing an IFP T-shirt.
Thank you Mr Sibanyoni.  Mr Lax, do you have any questions?
Thank you Chairperson.  Do you remember you got a letter from the TRC and you were asked to answer some questions?
You wrote a letter.  Did you write the letter, or did someone help you write the letter?
Did that person read the answers to you?
Yes, they did read them to me.

Now, in reply to the question and just for the benefit of the record, these questions appear in a letter at page 20 and 21 of the record, it is question 4 at page 20, the question was were any orders given to kill the five ANC members and if so, and I will leave out the first couple of parts, what was the specific orders/instructions?  Your answer appears on page 22 as follows, the instruction was that we must shoot/kill any ANC members in that particular area.

That ties in with your first bit of evidence that you gave to us in your evidence in chief, when you were being led by Mr Maharaj, that you went to that area and you were going to kill any person that you found in that area.
	Later on in your evidence, you then changed your evidence and you said well, we knew it was Mthetwa's place and Buxusa said that if we went there, we would find the people who had attacked us.
	I want you to explain why you gave this answer in reply to that question.
Why did you say that you went to attack any person you should find in that area?
It is because Mr Buxusa had already instructed us to go and kill in that area, in fact kill anybody who was present at the meeting.

You see that then makes your statement that the people you killed, were the very people who attacked you and your family and the Luthuli's family, and that you could identify them, totally irrelevant.
	It didn't matter to you whether they were part of the attack or not.  You went there to kill whoever you would find in that place?  Why did you have to identify anybody?
	Do you see my point?
Mr Buxusa gave this order, because IFP members' herds had been attacked.
Why did you wait six months before you went and attacked this area again?
We were still planning for the attack because we were actually afraid of them.
But you went and attacked people who were sitting down under a tree, drinking beer?  What were you afraid of, they didn't even have weapons on them?

The question was that you went and attacked people who were sitting down, unsuspecting, under a tree, drinking beer.  They didn't have weapons with them, you just arrived and attacked them.  What were you afraid of?
	You never met any resistance, did you?
We approached them whilst they were not suspecting that we would actually arrive there.
If you were afraid of them, why didn't you shoot them?  Why go up and slice them and stab them and cut them?

When we approached, we actually approached from a direction where there were a lot of trees, so they did not see us approaching.  If you are attacked in that manner, that is if you are unsuspecting, you are actually shocked when you realise that people are there to attack you, and when we actually came up on them, they were shocked because they were not expecting us.
You went there expecting to find an ANC meeting, is that right?
